text: basic English grammar lesson 3 topic the
simple past tense in part 3 we'll review
what we've learned so far and then we'll
practice forming questions do you like
to snack my favorite time of the day to
snack is late at night sometimes I eat
more for a snack than I do for dinner
two nights ago I've made some brownies
brownies are a kind of chocolate cake
half is already gone I ate most of this
by myself last night
I also have a snack but I didn't eat
something sweet let me show you what I
did did you pay attention to the verbs
in the simple past tense here they are
again I made some brownies I ate most of
this by myself last night I also had a
snack I didn't eat something sweet let
me show you what I did
okay now I will show you what I did as
you watch the video let's practice
forming this simple past tense will
practice with regular and irregular
verbs example you'll see a statement
like this and the verb will be in the
base form you put it in the simple past
the answer here
Jennifer cooked last night
one Jennifer got eggs and butter from
the refrigerator - she heated up the pan
three
Jennifer sliced a piece of butter and
put it in the pan for she opened the egg
carton
five Jennifer waited for the butter to
melt six
then she took out one egg and cracked it
open
seven jennifer threw away the eggshell
ate the egg began to fry
9 Jennifer flipped the egg and fried the
other side 10 finally she placed the egg
on a plate and ate it in previous
lessons we focused a lot on recognizing
and understanding the simple past tense
now we're really going to focus on using
the simple past tense let's begin with
asking questions forming questions do
you know these question words we use who
to ask about people what for things when
for time where for places why for
reasons how for manners which to
identify one thing or a group of things
and who's to ask about possession let's
first look at WH questions information
questions these are questions that ask
for specific information our model
question is what did Jennifer eat the
structure is question word what helping
verb did it signals the simple past
tense subject Jennifer and our main verb
always takes the form of a base verb
again our model question is what did
Jennifer eat the answer is she ate an
egg we used what as our question word
because we were asking about the thing
that she ate
let's try forming questions together
number 1 the answer is Jennifer had a
snack last night we're asking a question
about time so our question word is when
helping verb did subject Jennifer
base verb of had is
laughs so the question is when did
Jennifer have a snack - the answer is
Jennifer ate in the kitchen we're asking
about a place a question word is we're
helping verb did subject
Jennifer base verb eat where did
Jennifer eat question 3
if the answer is Jennifer fried an egg
because she was hungry what's the
question word we're asking about a
reason so the question word is why
helping verb did subject Jennifer base
verb fry why did Jennifer fry an egg
exercise one complete and then answer
the questions I'll give you a moment so
that you can practice forming the
questions on your own then if you're
studying by yourself write the answers
down if you're studying with a partner
take turns asking the questions one when
did you eat dinner yesterday two
what did you have for dinner number
three what time did you go to sleep last
night now number four is a little
different I'd like you to make this
question without a question word can you
do it the question is did you have a
snack before bedtime this question is a
little different because it's a yes/no
question questions that take a yes or no
answer do not use a question word such
as what where why etc in the previous
exercise we saw this question did you
have a snack before bedtime let's look
at the structure it's did plus the
subject plus the base verb did you have
a snack before bedtime we often give
short answers to yes/no questions for
example did you have a snack last night
yes I did or no I didn't note the full
forms yes I had a snack last night no I
didn't have a snack last night exercise
to find the mistakes example did you
cook dinner
no not cooked the mistake not cooked the
correction no I didn't cook one did you
have dinner with your family yes I had
the mistake I had the correction I did
yes I did to where you ate dinner last
night
we ate in the dining room the mistake
where you ate correction
where did you eat where did you eat
dinner last night
three why you did eat in the dining room
it was a special dinner it was my
father's birthday mistake why you did
eat correction why did you eat why did
you eat in the dining room for what did
you made we made my father's favorite
broiled fish and baked potato mistake
made correction make what did you make
end of part three
please go on to the next part of this
